meanings.definition: The failure of homologous chromosomes or sister chromatids to separate properly during cell division, resulting in an abnormal distribution of chromosomes in the daughter cells.
meanings.sent1: During cell division, nondisjunctions can lead to an incorrect number of chromosomes in the daughter cells.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study nondisjunctions to understand genetic disorders caused by chromosome abnormalities.
meanings.sent3: The biology class found it amusing how nondisjunctions could mess up the chromosome count in cells.
meanings.sent4: In the genetic lottery, nondisjunctions are like a player dropping multiple balls at once.
meanings.sent5: The image of nondisjunctions causing chaos in cell division stuck in the students' minds.
